text: Today is my very first day of traveling.
I feel excited, a little nervous, and full of curiosity. I truly hope this journey will be safe, filled with wonderful moments, new discoveries, and
memories that I will always carry with me. Stay with me to discover my exciting conversations at the airport.
Good morning. Where are you flying to today?
Good morning. I'm flying to Rome. May I see your passport, please?
Of course. Here it is. Are you checking in any luggage? Yes, I have one suitcase. Do you also have a carry-on bag?
Yes, just this small backpack. Please place your suitcase on the scale.
Sure. Here you go.
Would you like a window or an aisle seat?
A window seat, please. Perfect. Here is your boarding pass. Your gate is number 15. Thank you so much for your help.
Please put your suitcase on the belt. Do you need to remove your watch?
Sure. I'll also put my wallet and phone.
Should I remove my jacket?
Yes. And please take your laptop out of the bag. It must be scanned separately.
Okay. What about this water bottle?
Liquids are only allowed if they are under 100 ml in a clear bag. You can't bring that bottle.
All right, I'll throw it away. Thanks for explaining.
Excuse me. Where is the departures board?
You can see it over there just above the check-in counters.
Thank you. Is the flight to Berlin on time? Yes, you'll see your flight listed on it.
Great. And how do I get to gate A7?
Walk straight for about 200 m, then turn left. You'll see gate A7 on the right.
Got it. Thank you so much.
Welcome. Please place your carry-on in the overhead bin or under the seat.
Okay. Thank you. Could you move your coat so my bag fits? Sure, no problem.
Okay. Can I use my phone now?
Please keep it off for takeoff. Later, you can use airplane mode.
Got it. Could I have water and a sandwich? Also, a blanket, please.
Sure. Just a second and I'll bring them for you.
Welcome to Rome. Passport, please.
What's the purpose of your visit?
Here it is. I'm a tourist staying for 2 weeks at the Grand Hotel. Do you have anything to declare? Alcohol, tobacco, or goods over the limit?
No, only personal belongings. Very well.
Enjoy your stay in Rome.
If you enjoyed this video, make sure to hit the subscribe button and join our community. We share fun, simple, and
useful English learning videos every week. Don't miss out on new dialogues, stories, and tips that will make learning English easy and exciting for
